definitions.definition: an occasion when a vehicle or machine stops working

examples.text: Most breakdown services give priority to women travelling alone.
The national breakdown organizations are on hand to help motorists 24 hours a day.

definitions.definition: a failure of a relationship, discussion or system

examples.text: The only ground for divorce is the irretrievable breakdown of the marriage.
There has obviously been a breakdown in communications between the two sides.
The breakdown of the negotiations was not unexpected.
the complete breakdown of law and order
A growing proportion of children are affected by family breakdown.
Marital breakdown can be followed by debt problems.
Both sides blame each other for the breakdown in negotiations.

definitions.definition: detailed information that you get by studying a set of figures

examples.text: First, let's look at a breakdown of the costs.
Please provide us with a breakdown of expenditure by department.

definitions.definition: the process of a substance breaking into the parts of which it is made

examples.text: the breakdown of proteins in the digestive system

definitions.definition: a period of serious mental illness in which somebody is unable to deal with normal life

examples.text: It all became too much and he had some sort of breakdown.

phrases: the brink of a nervous breakdown
the edge of a nervous breakdown
the verge of a nervous breakdown
